description: From Medieval Latin summƒÅrius, from Latin summa.

adjectives.description: summary (comparative more summary, superlative most summary)

entries.meaning: Concise, brief or presented in a condensed form
examples: A summary review is in the appendix.

entries.meaning: Performed speedily and without formal ceremony.
examples: They used summary executions to break the resistance of the people.

entries.meaning: (law) Performed by skipping the procedures of a standard and fair trial.
An abstract or a condensed presentation of the substance of a body of material.
examples: I'd forgotten what happened in the first Harry Potter book so read a summary of the narrative before starting the second one.
make a summary of the events
